item.description:
The Joy of Consciousness

You go to a spa to give yourself a treat. Maybe you get a facial, manicure, or massage. When you go to a spiritual spa, however, it’s not for work on your body. It’s for soul work. What happens when you do soul work? You get more conscious. You begin to take control of your life. You learn how to give expression to the joy that’s your essence. You find the spiritual fulfillment that comes with connecting to your essential self, your soul.

Program:
“Peace in the Heart, Peace in the Home,” with Clare Vidich, director, Kirpal Meditation Center.
“Staying Sane in an Insane World,” with Zelma Chamberlain, award-winning DC educator.
Lunch
“What’s Your Exit Strategy: Spirituality and Aging,” with Sandy Glassman, Glassman Communications.

The day is free and includes meditation instructions, meditation, and a light vegetarian lunch.

Registration required.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be in Nordic Hall, immediately to the right of the entrance.

group.name: The Science of Spirituality Meditation Meetup

item.name: The Joy of Consciousness, A One-day Spiritual Spa for Women
